Sentencas: Nanoparticle electrodes are attractive for electrochemical energy storage applications because their nanoscale dimensions decrease ion transport distances and generally increase ion insertion/extraction efficiency.
Titulo: High -Throughput Single-Nanoparticle-Level Imaging of Electrochemical Ion Insertion Reactions

Sentencas: However, nanoparticles vary in size, shape, defect density, and surface composition, which warrants their investigation at the single-nanoparticle level.
Titulo: High -Throughput Single-Nanoparticle-Level Imaging of Electrochemical Ion Insertion Reactions

Sentencas: Here we demonstrate a non-destructive high-throughput electro-optical imaging approach to quantitatively measure electrochemical ion insertion reactions at the single-nanoparticle level.
Titulo: High -Throughput Single-Nanoparticle-Level Imaging of Electrochemical Ion Insertion Reactions

Sentencas: Electro-optical measurements relate the optical density change of a nanoparticle to redox changes of elements in the particle under working electrochemical conditions.
Titulo: High -Throughput Single-Nanoparticle-Level Imaging of Electrochemical Ion Insertion Reactions

Sentencas: We benchmarked this technique by studying Li-ion insertion in hexagonal tungsten oxide (h-WO3) nanorods during chronoamperometry and cyclic voltammetry.
Titulo: High -Throughput Single-Nanoparticle-Level Imaging of Electrochemical Ion Insertion Reactions

Sentencas: Interestingly, the optically detected current response revealed underlying processes that are hidden in the conventional electrochemical current measurements.
Titulo: High -Throughput Single-Nanoparticle-Level Imaging of Electrochemical Ion Insertion Reactions

Sentencas: This imaging technique may be applied to 13 nm particles and a wide range of electrochemical systems such as electrochromic smart windows, batteries, solid oxide fuel cells, and sensors.
Titulo: High -Throughput Single-Nanoparticle-Level Imaging of Electrochemical Ion Insertion Reactions
